questions.question_text:
A self-organizing team for a critical project is consistently delivering value according to their commitments. During a retrospective, the project manager observed that most of the team members were stressed due to over commitments.
What should the project manager do?

choices.A: Support the team during the planning phase to only commit to what they are able to deliver
choices.B: Request additional resources to continue delivering value while reducing team stress
choices.D: Help the team members by organizing regular stress-relieving and team- building sessions
choices.C: Ask individual team members to plan staggered leave to avoid becoming stressed

discussion.content:

questions.question_text:
A project manager works for a company that has a reputation of delivering environmentally sustainable projects. During the half- yearly review of the project, the project manager raises serious concerns with the project sponsor regarding the project's viability and success. There are some stakeholders who oppose this project on the grounds of compromising land erosion.

What should the project manager do?

choices.B: Plan the project with a predictive approach and a work breakdown structure (WBS) following the plan and deliver value at the end of the project.
choices.A: Plan the project with a predictive approach with a work breakdown structure (WBS) and then execute it using an agile approach to deliver value incrementally.
choices.D: Select an agile approach and manage the project according to best practices to ensure value is delivered to the client.
choices.C: Agree on a minimum viable product (MVP) first to be delivered immediately with the client and then release the rest of the scope at the end of the project.
